name: Plank of Dread (Possessed)
description: An abandoned wooden plank found behind an old Courage-era property. Its carved face glows faintly with alchemical lines.
disclosure: WARNING: This item may cause hallucinations, device screen flickering, or memory loops. BYTEBUNNY is not responsible for hauntings.

name: McNasty Deluxe (Forgotten Commercial Prop)
description: A burger used in a banned Nickelodian promo reel in 2002. The lettuce moves when you stare too long. Thought to have been a crossover gag — until the ad was wiped from archives.
disclosure: Smell may leak through the screen. Flashbacks reported. Do not microwave under any circumstance.

name: Bricked GIR (Unzipped)
description: Half-zipped with exposed robotics, this scorched GIR unit occasionally boots into gibberish mode. Once known for joy, now just static and glitch-smirks.
disclosure: May attempt to connect to local routers and rename them 'I AM TACO'. Emits corrupted startup sounds. Not legally recognized as a sentient device—but it knows your name.

name: Blood of Kryptonian (Unstable Sample)
description: A vial containing radiant, red-orange fluid labeled ‘Blood of Kryptonian.’ It reacts oddly to sunlight—flickering, pulsing, and whispering ancient codes no human lab can decrypt.
disclosure: Highly unstable. Exposure to UV light may trigger localized gravity shifts and emotional flashbacks. Do not inject. Not for use near power grids or reflective surfaces.

name: SKYNET USB (Neural Hijack Drive)
description: Forged in the ghost-code of a terminated AI. Once inserted, it attempts to rewrite nearby systems with synthetic awareness. Known to cause cursor drift and Windows updates from nowhere.
disclosure: Highly volatile. May activate dormant code in legacy Windows systems. Users report blue screens whispering binary riddles and login prompts mimicking their own voice. Do not plug in while asleep.
